bibl.title: Ancient Egyptomania: The Uses of Egypt in Graeco-Roman Alexandria.
bibl.note: The Tigrane Tomb stands apart from the other uses of Egypt in Alexandrian tomb painting: its narrative scenes attempt to replicate the style of ancient Egypt in order to invoke the country's venerable past.

bibl.title: Leaving No Stones Unturned. Essays on the Ancient Near East and Egypt in Honor of Donald P. Hansen

bibl.seg: VENIT Marjorie Susan, Ancient Egyptomania: The Uses of Egypt in Graeco-Roman Alexandria.
Erica EHRENBERG (Ed.), Leaving No Stones Unturned. Essays on the Ancient Near East and Egypt in Honor of Donald P. Hansen (Winona Lake, Indiana, 2002) pp. 261-278, 12 figg.

The Tigrane Tomb stands apart from the other uses of Egypt in Alexandrian tomb painting: its narrative scenes attempt to replicate the style of ancient Egypt in order to invoke the country's venerable past.
